# What is vision for?

## Information at a distance

![James Webb space telescope deep field @noauthor_undated-vq](https://stsci-opo.org/STScI-01G7DCYVZ899DGSY684E801B2Y.png)

- Light (+ radiowaves) circumnavigate the Earth in ~133 ms
- Earth ~8.3 light-minutes from the Sun

::: {.incremental}

- Elevation (up/down)
- Distance (near/far)
- Orientation
:::

- Surfaces
- Objects
- Entities
:::

# Detecting information in light

## What information?

- Position
- Length
- Area
- Color
- Texture
- (Motion)

## The eye

## is like an auto-focus, auto-exposure camera...

![](https://www.optilase.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/camera-lens-eye-lens.jpg)

## part of a self-stabilizing system...

{{< video https://www.youtube.com/embed/JGArTWOJtXs?start=7 width="100%" height="70%" class="center_img">}}

@Bucalo2015-qm

## Eye + head + body system

::: {.callout-note}
- Eye + head + body movements *align and point* the eyes
- Eye + head + body movements *stabilize* the eyes
  - When the observer moves
  - When objects move
:::

## Demo

- May I have a volunteer?

## Image formation

- Eye's optical components
  - Cornea (fixed refraction)
  - Iris/pupil (*modifiable* aperture)
  - Lens (*modifiable* refraction) 
- Create projection (image) on retina

## The retina...

![](https://www.feinberg.northwestern.edu/gfx/news/retina.jpg){fig-align="center"}

- samples spatial patterns of light intensity & wavelength patterns

## 'Wavelength-tuned' photoreceptors

![Source: Wikipedia](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/94/1416_Color_Sensitivity.jpg/1200px-1416_Color_Sensitivity.jpg)

---

![Retinal rods (green) & cones (blue)](https://i.pinimg.com/originals/9f/08/85/9f0885d4c209d5275f631ac194eb4f4b.jpg)

---

### ...arranged in mosaics

![Normal color vision vs. protanopic (color blind) vision; Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Retinal_mosaic](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a6/ConeMosaics.jpg)

---

### with different concentrations in different parts of the retina

![Wikipedia](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3c/Human_photoreceptor_distribution.svg/1200px-Human_photoreceptor_distribution.svg.png)

## Consequences

- Must move eyes to position highest resolution part of retina over target
- Keep track of sequence of eye movements and positions over time
- Integrate sequence of samples over time

---

![@Cairo2013-hm Figure 5.6](../include/img/cairo-fig-5.6.png)

## Information processing

- Separate channels for short, medium, long wavelengths (cones): chromatic (color)
- Black/gray/white or overall illumination (rods): achromatic (dark/light)
- ~120 M rods + ~ 5 M cones (125 M) vs. professional cameras with 100 M pixels

---

- Point by point, topographic (map-like) 2D image of 3D world
- Non-uniform resolution (center >> periphery)
- yields focused image except...

---

- Vernier
- Symbol/letter (optotype) acuity

## Contrast sensitivity

- Light/dark ratio (contast)
- vs. spatial frequency (level of detail)
- Contrast -> edges; edges -> shape/form
- e.g., driving in fog

---

![Contrast sensitivity function](https://www.psychophysics.uk/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/typical-contrast-sensitivity-function.jpg)

---

![Pelli-Robson Contrast Sensitivity Chart](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/313816987/figure/fig2/AS:614249734864898@1523459957272/Pelli-Robson-contrast-sensitivity-chart-Precision-Vision-LaSalle-IL-11-The_Q640.jpg)

## Color perception

- Perceived color a function of activity in "R", "G", and "B" photoreceptors

![Source: Wikipedia](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/94/1416_Color_Sensitivity.jpg/1200px-1416_Color_Sensitivity.jpg)

## Wavelengths are continuous, but are perceived colors?

![https://rmit.pressbooks.pub/colourtheory1/part/2-colour-theory-the-visible-spectrum/](https://rmit.pressbooks.pub/app/uploads/sites/42/2022/10/visitble-spectrum-nm.png)

## Perceived colors seem ordinal, but...

![](https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2013/07/12/19/20/rainbow-colors-154569_1280.png)

- Color is a neuropsychological construct

## Color vision anomalies

- Absence of or anomalies in photoreceptors

![@Wong2011-ke Figure 1](https://media.springernature.com/full/springer-static/image/art%3A10.1038%2Fnmeth.1618/MediaObjects/41592_2011_Article_BFnmeth1618_Fig1_HTML.jpg?as=webp)

## Types

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width=40%}
- Protanopia (impaired R/long wavelength)
- Deuteranopia (impaired G/medium wavelength)
- Tritanopia (impaired B/short wavelength)
:::
::: {.column width=60%}
![https://www.color-blindness.com/protanopia-red-green-color-blindness/](https://www.color-blindness.com/wp-content/images/Protanopia-Color-Spectrum.jpg)
:::
::::

## Some consequences for data figures

- Size of visual elements (symbols, including text)
- Contrast (light/dark or color)
- Textures of visual patterns
- Some colors more visible than others
  - [Vischeck](https://www.vischeck.com/)
- How much visual scanning (# of eye movements)?

# Main points

---

- Visual perception a *reconstruction* of reality
- Continuous pattern of light $\rightarrow$ intensity detected by 4 photoreceptor types
- Retina has non-uniform sensivity to light, so some information more easily detected
